blocks.name: cwrecs
blocks.content: Declare syntax for the well-founded recursive function generator.
blocks.origin: prop class cwrecs(class c0, class c1, class c2) { wrecs(c0, c1, c2) }

blocks.name: diff.cwrecs.s
diff.cwrecs.c
diff.cwrecs.w
df-wrecs
blocks.content: Here we define the well-founded recursive function generator. This function takes the usual expressions from recursion theorems and forms a unified definition. Specifically, given a function ` F ` , a relationship ` R ` , and a base set ` A ` , this definition generates a function ` G = wrecs ( R , A , F ) ` that has property that, at any point ` x e. A ` , ` ( G `` x ) = ( F `` ( G |`` Pred ( R , A , x ) ) ) ` . See ~ wfr1 , ~ wfr2 , and ~ wfr3 . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 7-Jun-2018.) (New usage is discouraged.)

axiom df-wrecs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(cwrecs(c0, c1, c2), cuni(cab(s0, wex(s1, w3a(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wa(wss(cv(s1), c1), wral(s2, cv(s1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(s2)), cv(s1)))), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(s0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(s2)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-wrecs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ wrecs(c0, c1, c2)= ⋃ { s0 | ∃(s1,(s0[Fn]s1 ∧(s1 ⊆ c1 ∧ ∀(s2 ∈ s1, Pred(c0, c1, s2)⊆ s1))∧ ∀(s2 ∈ s1,(s0 ` s2)=(c2 `(s0 |` Pred(c0, c1, s2))))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
}

  unieqd(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c4, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c2, cv(hs2))))))))), cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c3), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c3, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c5, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c3, cv(hs2))))))))), w3a(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3), wceq(c4, c5)))

  exbidv(hs1, w3a(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3), wceq(c4, c5)), w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c4, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c2, cv(hs2))))))), w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c3), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c3, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c5, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c3, cv(hs2))))))))
  3anbi23d(w3a(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3), wceq(c4, c5)), wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c4, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c2, cv(hs2)))))), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c3), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c3, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c5, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c3, cv(hs2)))))))

  eqeq2d(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c4, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c2, cv(hs2)))), cfv(c5, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c3, cv(hs2)))), w3a(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3), wceq(c4, c5)))

  diff.hs1.w(w3a(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3), wceq(c4, c5)))

thm wrecseq123(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ⊢ ((c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5)→ wrecs(c0, c2, c4)= wrecs(c1, c3, c5))
} = {
  3eqtr4g(wrecs(c0, c2, c4), wrecs(c1, c3, c5), ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c0, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c4 `(hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2))))))}, ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c5 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2))))))}, (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  unieqd({ hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c0, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c4 `(hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2))))))}, { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c5 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2))))))}, (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  abbidv(hs0, (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5), ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c0, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c4 `(hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2)))))), ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c5 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2)))))))
  exbidv(hs1, (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5), (hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c0, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c4 `(hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2))))), (hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c5 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2))))))
  3anbi23d((c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5), hs0[Fn]hs1, (hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c0, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1)), ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c4 `(hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2)))), (hs1 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2)⊆ hs1)), ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c5 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2)))))
  anbi12d((c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5), hs1 ⊆ c2, ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c0, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1), hs1 ⊆ c3, ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2)⊆ hs1))
  3ad2ant2(c0 = c1, c2 = c3, c4 = c5, (hs1 ⊆ c2 ↔ hs1 ⊆ c3))
  sseq2(c2, c3, hs1)
  ralbidv(hs2, hs1, (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5), Pred(c0, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2)⊆ hs1)
  sseq1d(Pred(c0, c2, hs2), hs1, Pred(c1, c3, hs2), (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  3adant3(c0 = c1, c2 = c3, c4 = c5, Pred(c0, c2, hs2)= Pred(c1, c3, hs2))
  ralbidv(hs2, hs1, (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5), (hs0 ` hs2)=(c4 `(hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2))), (hs0 ` hs2)=(c5 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2))))
  eqeq2d((hs0 ` hs2), (c4 `(hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2))), (c5 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2))), (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  fveq12d(c4, (hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2)), c5, (hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2)), (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  simp3(c0 = c1, c2 = c3, c4 = c5)
  3adant3(c0 = c1, c2 = c3, c4 = c5, (hs0 |` Pred(c0, c2, hs2))=(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c3, hs2)))
  reseq2d(hs0, Pred(c0, c2, hs2), Pred(c1, c3, hs2), (c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3))
  sylan9eq(Pred(c0, c2, hs2), Pred(c1, c3, hs2), Pred(c1, c2, hs2), c0 = c1, c2 = c3)
  predeq1(c0, c1, c2, hs2)
  predeq2(c2, c3, c1, hs2)
  df-wrecs(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, c2, c4)
  df-wrecs(hs0, hs1, hs2, c1, c3, c5)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  diff.hs1.w((c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  diff.hs2.w((c0 = c1 ∧ c2 = c3 ∧ c4 = c5))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs2.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs2.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs2.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs1.c(c5)
  diff.hs2.c(c5)
}

blocks.name: nfwrecs
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for the well-founded recursive function generator. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 9-Jun-2018.)

thm nfwrecs(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wnfc(s0, cwrecs(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c1)
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
} = {
  nfcxfr(s0, cwrecs(c0, c1, c2), cuni(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c1), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)))))))))))
  df-wrecs(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1, c2)
  nfuni(s0, cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c1), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2))))))))))
  nfab(s0, hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c1), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)))))))))
  nfex(s0, hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c1), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2))))))))
  nf3an(s0, wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c1), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)))))))
  nfv(s0, wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  nfan(s0, wss(cv(hs1), c1), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))))
  nfss(s0, cv(hs1), c1)
  nfral(s0, hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))
  nfss(s0, cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1))
  nfral(s0, hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2))))))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs1))
  nfeq2(s0, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)))))
  nffv(s0, c2, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2))))
  nfres(s0, cv(hs0), cpred(c0, c1, cv(hs2)))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs0))
  nfpred(s0, c0, c1, cv(hs2))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs2))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs2.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.c(c2)
  diff.wfn.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(hs2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm nfwrecs(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ F/(s0, wrecs(c0, c1, c2))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c1)

blocks.name: wfrlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. The final item we are interested in is the union of acceptable functions ` B ` . This lemma just changes bound variables for later use. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.)

blocks.name: wfrlem2
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. An acceptable function is a function. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.)

thm wfrlem2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wfun(cv(s0)))
  -| wceq(c0, cab(s1, wex(s2, w3a(wfn(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wa(wss(cv(s2), c1), wral(s3, cv(s2), wss(cpred(c2, c1, cv(s3)), cv(s2)))), wral(s3, cv(s2), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(s1), cpred(c2, c1, cv(s3))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
  -| diffsc(s3, c2)
  -| diffsc(s3, c3)

blocks.content: Obsolete version of ~ wfrlem4 as of 18-Jul-2022. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm wfrlem4OLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| wceq(c0, cab(s3, wex(s4, w3a(wfn(cv(s3), cv(s4)), wa(wss(cv(s4), c3), wral(s5, cv(s4), wss(cpred(c2, c3, cv(s5)), cv(s4)))), wral(s5, cv(s4), wceq(cfv(cv(s3), cv(s5)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s3), cpred(c2, c3, cv(s5))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)

} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wa(wfn(cres(cv(s0), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), wral(s2, cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1))), wceq(cfv(cres(cv(s0), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), cv(s2)), cfv(c1, cres(cres(cv(s0), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), cpred(c2, cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1))), cv(s2)))))))), wwe(c2, c3))

blocks.name: wfrlem5
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. The values of two acceptable functions agree within their domains. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm wfrlem5(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wi(wa(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s4))), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4))))
  -| wwe(c1, c2)
  -| wse(c1, c2)
  -| wceq(c0, cab(s5, wex(s2, w3a(wfn(cv(s5), cv(s2)), wa(wss(cv(s2), c2), wral(s6, cv(s2), wss(cpred(c1, c2, cv(s6)), cv(s2)))), wral(s6, cv(s2), wceq(cfv(cv(s5), cv(s6)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(s5), cpred(c1, c2, cv(s6))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s6)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s5, s6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s5, c1)
  -| diffsc(s5, c2)
  -| diffsc(s5, c3)
  -| diffsc(s6, c1)
  -| diffsc(s6, c2)
  -| diffsc(s6, c3)
} = {
  syl5(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wa(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s4))), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4)), wa(wbr(cv(s2), cres(cv(s0), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cres(cv(s1), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), cv(s4))))
  mpancom(wa(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s4))), wa(wbr(cv(s2), cres(cv(s0), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cres(cv(s1), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), cv(s4))), wcel(cv(s2), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))))
  sylibr(wa(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s4))), wcel(cv(s2), cin(cdm(cv(s0)), cdm(cv(s1)))), wa(wcel(cv(s2), cdm(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s2), cdm(cv(s1)))))

  breldm(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s3))
  breldm(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s4))

  |- wrel(c0)

  mprgbir(hs3, cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2))))))))), wrel(cuni(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2))))))))))), wrel(cv(hs3)))
  reluni(hs3, cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2))))))))))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs3), cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2)))))))))), wrel(cv(hs3)), wfun(cv(hs3)))
  wfrlem2(hs3, hs0, hs1, hs2, cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2))))))))), c2, c1, c3)
  eqid(cab(hs0, wex(hs1, w3a(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wss(cv(hs1), c2), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs0), cpred(c1, c2, cv(hs2))))))))))
  funrel(cv(hs3))

thm wfrrel(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ Rel(c0)
  ⊣ c0 = wrecs(c1, c2, c3)

  mpbir(Rel(c0), Rel(⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))}))
  mprgbir(hs3, { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))}, Rel(⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))}), Rel(hs3))
  reluni(hs3, { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))})
  syl(hs3 ∈ { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))}, Rel(hs3), Fun(hs3))
  wfrlem2(hs3, hs0, hs1, hs2, { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))}, c2, c1, c3)
  eqid({ hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))})
  funrel(hs3)
  releqi(c0, ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))})
  eqtri(c0, ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))}, wrecs(c1, c2, c3))
  df-wrecs(hs0, hs1, hs2, c1, c2, c3)
  diff.hs3.c({ hs0 | ∃(hs1,(hs0[Fn]hs1 ∧(hs1 ⊆ c2 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1, Pred(c1, c2, hs2)⊆ hs1))∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs1,(hs0 ` hs2)=(c3 `(hs0 |` Pred(c1, c2, hs2))))))})

  -| wceq(c0, cwrecs(c2, c1, c3))

  eqtri(cdm(c0), ciun(hs0, cab(hs1, wex(hs2, w3a(wfn(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), wa(wss(cv(hs2), c1), wral(hs3, cv(hs2), wss(cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs3)), cv(hs2)))), wral(hs3, cv(hs2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs1), cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs3))))))))), cdm(cv(hs0))), cdm(cuni(cab(hs1, wex(hs2, w3a(wfn(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), wa(wss(cv(hs2), c1), wral(hs3, cv(hs2), wss(cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs3)), cv(hs2)))), wral(hs3, cv(hs2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs1), cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs3))))))))))))
  dmeqi(c0, cuni(cab(hs1, wex(hs2, w3a(wfn(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), wa(wss(cv(hs2), c1), wral(hs3, cv(hs2), wss(cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs3)), cv(hs2)))), wral(hs3, cv(hs2), wceq(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)), cfv(c3, cres(cv(hs1), cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs3)))))))))))

blocks.name: wfrlem8
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. Compute the prececessor class for an ` R ` minimal element of ` ( A \ dom F ) ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm wfrlem8(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wb(wceq(cpred(c0, cdif(c1, cdm(c2)), c3), emptycls), wceq(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, cwrecs(c0, c1, c4))
} = {
  3bitr4i(wceq(cpred(c0, cdif(c1, cdm(c2)), c3), emptycls), wceq(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)), wss(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)), wa(wss(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)), wss(cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3), cpred(c0, c1, c3))))
  biantru(wss(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)), wss(cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3), cpred(c0, c1, c3)))
  ax-mp(wss(cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3), cpred(c0, c1, c3)), wss(cdm(c2), c1))
  wfrdmss(c2, c1, c0, c4)
  predpredss(cdm(c2), c1, c0, c3)
  bitr4i(wceq(cpred(c0, cdif(c1, cdm(c2)), c3), emptycls), wss(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)), wceq(cdif(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)), emptycls))
  eqeq1i(cpred(c0, cdif(c1, cdm(c2)), c3), emptycls, cdif(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3)))
  preddif(c0, c1, cdm(c2), c3)
  ssdif0(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3))
  eqss(cpred(c0, c1, c3), cpred(c0, cdm(c2), c3))
}

thm wfrlem8(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ (Pred(c0,(c1 \ dom(c2)), c3)= ∅ ↔ Pred(c0, c1, c3)= Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3))
  ⊣ c2 = wrecs(c0, c1, c4)
} = {
  3bitr4i(Pred(c0,(c1 \ dom(c2)), c3)= ∅, Pred(c0, c1, c3)= Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3), Pred(c0, c1, c3)⊆ Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3), (Pred(c0, c1, c3)⊆ Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3)∧ Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3)⊆ Pred(c0, c1, c3)))
  biantru(Pred(c0, c1, c3)⊆ Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3), Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3)⊆ Pred(c0, c1, c3))
  ax-mp(Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3)⊆ Pred(c0, c1, c3), dom(c2)⊆ c1)
  wfrdmss(c2, c1, c0, c4)
  predpredss(dom(c2), c1, c0, c3)
  bitr4i(Pred(c0,(c1 \ dom(c2)), c3)= ∅, Pred(c0, c1, c3)⊆ Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3), (Pred(c0, c1, c3)\ Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3))= ∅)
  eqeq1i(Pred(c0,(c1 \ dom(c2)), c3), emptycls, (Pred(c0, c1, c3)\ Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3)))
  preddif(c0, c1, dom(c2), c3)
  ssdif0(Pred(c0, c1, c3), Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3))
  eqss(Pred(c0, c1, c3), Pred(c0, dom(c2), c3))
}

blocks.name: wfrlem10
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. When ` z ` is an ` R ` minimal element of ` ( A \ dom F ) ` , then its predecessor class is equal to ` dom F ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.)

thm wfrlem10(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

} = {

  eqelssd(hs0, Pred(c2, dom(c1), s0), dom(c1), s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)))
  a1i(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), Pred(c2, dom(c1), s0)⊆ dom(c1))

  simpr(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), hs0 ∈ dom(c1))
  ecase23d((s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1))∧ hs0 ∈ dom(c1)), hs0[c2]s0, hs0 = s0, s0[c2]hs0)
  imp(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), hs0 ∈ dom(c1), ¬ hs0 = s0)
  con2d(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), hs0 ∈ dom(c1), hs0 = s0)
  syl5ibrcom(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), hs0 = s0, ¬ hs0 ∈ dom(c1), ¬ s0 ∈ dom(c1))
  notbid(hs0 = s0, hs0 ∈ dom(c1), s0 ∈ dom(c1))
  eleq1w(hs0, s0, dom(c1))
  mtbid((s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1))∧ hs0 ∈ dom(c1)), s0[c2]hs0, s0 ∈ Pred(c2, c0, hs0))

  syl5com(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), Pred(c2, c0, hs0)⊆ dom(c1), ¬ s0 ∈ Pred(c2, c0, hs0), ¬ s0 ∈ dom(c1))

  con3d(Pred(c2, c0, hs0)⊆ dom(c1), s0 ∈ dom(c1), s0 ∈ Pred(c2, c0, hs0))
  ssel(Pred(c2, c0, hs0), dom(c1), s0)
  wfrdmcl(hs0, c1, c2, c0, c3)
  sylan(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), hs0 ∈ dom(c1), (s0 ∈ Pred(c2, c0, hs0)↔ s0[c2]hs0), s0 ∈ c0)
  ancoms(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ dom(c1), (s0 ∈ Pred(c2, c0, hs0)↔ s0[c2]hs0))
  elpredg(hs0, dom(c1), s0, c0, c2)
  syl2anr(s0 ∈(c0 \ dom(c1)), hs0 ∈ dom(c1), (hs0[c2]s0 ∨ hs0 = s0 ∨ s0[c2]hs0), hs0 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ c0)
  sseli(hs0, dom(c1), c0)
  wfrdmss(c1, c0, c2, c3)
  eldifi(s0, c0, dom(c1))
  mpan((hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), (hs0[c2]s0 ∨ hs0 = s0 ∨ s0[c2]hs0), c2 ≺ c0)

blocks.name: wfrlem12
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. Here, we compute the value of the recursive definition generator. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: wfrlem13
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. From here through ~ wfrlem16 , we aim to prove that ` dom F = A ` . We do this by supposing that there is an element ` z ` of ` A ` that is not in ` dom F ` . We then define ` C ` by extending ` dom F ` with the appropriate value at ` z ` . We then show that ` z ` cannot be an ` R ` minimal element of ` ( A \ dom F ) ` , meaning that ` ( A \ dom F ) ` must be empty, so ` dom F = A ` . Here, we show that ` C ` is a function extending the domain of ` F ` by one. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: wfrlem15
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. When ` z ` is ` R ` minimal, ` C ` is an acceptable function. This step is where the Axiom of Replacement becomes required. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.)

blocks.name: wfrlem16
blocks.content: Lemma for well-founded recursion. If ` z ` is ` R ` minimal in ` ( A \ dom F ) ` , then ` C ` is acceptable and thus a subset of ` F ` , but ` dom C ` is bigger than ` dom F ` . Thus, ` z ` cannot be minimal, so ` ( A \ dom F ) ` must be empty, and (due to ~ wfrdmss ), ` dom F = A ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.)

  sylibr((c0 ∈ dom(c1)∧((< c0,(c1 ` c0)> ∈ hs0 ∧ hs0 ∈ { hs1 | ∃(hs2,(hs1[Fn]hs2 ∧(hs2 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2, Pred(c2, c3, hs3)⊆ hs2))∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2,(hs1 ` hs3)=(c4 `(hs1 |` Pred(c2, c3, hs3))))))})∧(hs0[Fn]hs4 ∧(hs4 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs5 ∈ hs4, Pred(c2, c3, hs5)⊆ hs4))))), c0[hs0](c1 ` c0), < c0,(c1 ` c0)> ∈ hs0)
  simprll(c0 ∈ dom(c1), < c0,(c1 ` c0)> ∈ hs0, hs0 ∈ { hs1 | ∃(hs2,(hs1[Fn]hs2 ∧(hs2 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2, Pred(c2, c3, hs3)⊆ hs2))∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2,(hs1 ` hs3)=(c4 `(hs1 |` Pred(c2, c3, hs3))))))}, (hs0[Fn]hs4 ∧(hs4 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs5 ∈ hs4, Pred(c2, c3, hs5)⊆ hs4))))
  df-br(c0, hs0, (c1 ` c0))
  mp3an2(c0 ∈ dom(c1), c0[hs0](c1 ` c0), c0 ∈ dom(hs0), (c1 ` c0)∈ 𝕌)
  fvex(c1, c0)
  breldmg(c0, dom(c1), (c1 ` c0), universe, hs0)
  syl((c0 ∈ dom(c1)∧((< c0,(c1 ` c0)> ∈ hs0 ∧ hs0 ∈ { hs1 | ∃(hs2,(hs1[Fn]hs2 ∧(hs2 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2, Pred(c2, c3, hs3)⊆ hs2))∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2,(hs1 ` hs3)=(c4 `(hs1 |` Pred(c2, c3, hs3))))))})∧(hs0[Fn]hs4 ∧(hs4 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs5 ∈ hs4, Pred(c2, c3, hs5)⊆ hs4))))), dom(hs0)= hs4, hs0[Fn]hs4)
  simprrl(c0 ∈ dom(c1), (< c0,(c1 ` c0)> ∈ hs0 ∧ hs0 ∈ { hs1 | ∃(hs2,(hs1[Fn]hs2 ∧(hs2 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2, Pred(c2, c3, hs3)⊆ hs2))∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ hs2,(hs1 ` hs3)=(c4 `(hs1 |` Pred(c2, c3, hs3))))))}), hs0[Fn]hs4, (hs4 ⊆ c3 ∧ ∀(hs5 ∈ hs4, Pred(c2, c3, hs5)⊆ hs4)))
  fndm(hs0, hs4)
  fun2ssres(c1, hs0, Pred(c2, c3, c0))
  resex(hs0, Pred(c2, c3, c0))
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ dom(c1))
  diff.hs0.w((c1 |` Pred(c2, c3, c0))∈ 𝕌)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs2.s(hs3)

  diff.hs4.w((c1 |` Pred(c2, c3, c0))∈ 𝕌)
  diff.hs5.c(c0)
  diff.hs5.c(hs4)

blocks.name: wfr2a
blocks.content: A weak version of ~ wfr2 which is useful for proofs that avoid the Axiom of Replacement. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 30-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm wfr2a(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cdm(c1)), wceq(cfv(c1, c0), cfv(c2, cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, c0)))))
  -| wwe(c3, c4)
  -| wse(c3, c4)
  -| wceq(c1, cwrecs(c3, c4, c2))
} = {
  vtoclga(hs0, c0, cdm(c1), wceq(cfv(c1, c0), cfv(c2, cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, c0)))), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, cv(hs0))))))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, cv(hs0)))), cfv(c1, c0), cfv(c2, cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, c0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  fveq2d(c2, cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, cv(hs0))), cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  reseq2d(c1, cpred(c3, c4, cv(hs0)), cpred(c3, c4, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  predeq3(cv(hs0), c0, c3, c4)
  wfrlem12(hs0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cdm(c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(c1, c0), cfv(c2, cres(c1, cpred(c3, c4, c0)))))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm wfr2a(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ dom(c1)→(c1 ` c0)=(c2 `(c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, c0))))
  ⊣ c3 ≤ c4
  ⊣ c3[Se]c4
  ⊣ c1 = wrecs(c3, c4, c2)
} = {
  vtoclga(hs0, c0, dom(c1), (c1 ` c0)=(c2 `(c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, c0))), (c1 ` hs0)=(c2 `(c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, hs0))))
  eqeq12d((c1 ` hs0), (c2 `(c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, hs0))), (c1 ` c0), (c2 `(c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, c0))), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, c1)
  fveq2d(c2, (c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, hs0)), (c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, c0)), hs0 = c0)
  reseq2d(c1, Pred(c3, c4, hs0), Pred(c3, c4, c0), hs0 = c0)
  predeq3(hs0, c0, c3, c4)
  wfrlem12(hs0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(dom(c1))
  diff.hs0.w((c1 ` c0)=(c2 `(c1 |` Pred(c3, c4, c0))))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}

blocks.name: wfr1
blocks.content: The Principle of Well-Founded Recursion, part 1 of 3. We start with an arbitrary function ` G ` . Then, using a base class ` A ` and a well-ordering ` R ` of ` A ` , we define a function ` F ` . This function is said to be defined by "well-founded recursion." The purpose of these three theorems is to demonstrate the properties of ` F ` . We begin by showing that ` F ` is a function over ` A ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 22-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm wfr1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wfn(c0, c1)
  -| wwe(c2, c1)
  -| wse(c2, c1)
  -| wceq(c0, cwrecs(c2, c1, c3))
} = {
  mpbir2an(wfn(c0, c1), wfun(c0), wceq(cdm(c0), c1))
  wfrfun(c0, c2, c1, c3)
  wfrlem16(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cun(c0, csn(cop(cv(hs0), cfv(c3, cres(c0, cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs0))))))))
  eqid(cun(c0, csn(cop(cv(hs0), cfv(c3, cres(c0, cpred(c2, c1, cv(hs0))))))))
  df-fn(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm wfr1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ c0[Fn]c1
  ⊣ c2 ≤ c1
  ⊣ c2[Se]c1
  ⊣ c0 = wrecs(c2, c1, c3)
} = {
  mpbir2an(c0[Fn]c1, Fun(c0), dom(c0)= c1)
  wfrfun(c0, c2, c1, c3)
  wfrlem16(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, (c0 ⋃ { < hs0,(c3 `(c0 |` Pred(c2, c1, hs0)))> }))
  eqid((c0 ⋃ { < hs0,(c3 `(c0 |` Pred(c2, c1, hs0)))> }))
  df-fn(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: wfr2
blocks.content: The Principle of Well-Founded Recursion, part 2 of 3. Next, we show that the value of ` F ` at any ` X e. A ` is ` G ` recursively applied to all "previous" values of ` F ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 18-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm wfr2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), cfv(c3, cres(c2, cpred(c4, c1, c0)))))
  -| wwe(c4, c1)
  -| wse(c4, c1)
  -| wceq(c2, cwrecs(c4, c1, c3))
} = {
  sylbir(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), cfv(c3, cres(c2, cpred(c4, c1, c0)))), wcel(c0, cdm(c2)))
  eleq2i(c0, cdm(c2), c1)
  wfrlem16(hs0, c2, c1, c4, c3, cun(c2, csn(cop(cv(hs0), cfv(c3, cres(c2, cpred(c4, c1, cv(hs0))))))))
  eqid(cun(c2, csn(cop(cv(hs0), cfv(c3, cres(c2, cpred(c4, c1, cv(hs0))))))))
  wfr2a(c0, c2, c3, c4, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm wfr2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c2 ` c0)=(c3 `(c2 |` Pred(c4, c1, c0))))
  ⊣ c4 ≤ c1
  ⊣ c4[Se]c1
  ⊣ c2 = wrecs(c4, c1, c3)
} = {
  sylbir(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ` c0)=(c3 `(c2 |` Pred(c4, c1, c0))), c0 ∈ dom(c2))
  eleq2i(c0, dom(c2), c1)
  wfrlem16(hs0, c2, c1, c4, c3, (c2 ⋃ { < hs0,(c3 `(c2 |` Pred(c4, c1, hs0)))> }))
  eqid((c2 ⋃ { < hs0,(c3 `(c2 |` Pred(c4, c1, hs0)))> }))
  wfr2a(c0, c2, c3, c4, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}

blocks.name: wfr3
blocks.content: The principle of Well-Founded Recursion, part 3 of 3. Finally, we show that ` F ` is unique. We do this by showing that any function ` H ` with the same properties we proved of ` F ` in ~ wfr1 and ~ wfr2 is identical to ` F ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 18-Apr-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm wfr3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cres(c0, cpred(c3, c1, cv(s0))))))), wceq(c4, c0))
  -| wwe(c3, c1)
  -| wse(c3, c1)
  -| wceq(c4, cwrecs(c3, c1, c2))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  mp3an12(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cres(c0, cpred(c3, c1, cv(s0))))))), wceq(c4, c0), wa(wwe(c3, c1), wse(c3, c1)), wa(wfn(c4, c1), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cres(c4, cpred(c3, c1, cv(s0))))))))
  pm3.2i(wwe(c3, c1), wse(c3, c1))
  pm3.2i(wfn(c4, c1), wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cres(c4, cpred(c3, c1, cv(s0)))))))
  wfr1(c4, c1, c3, c2)
  rgen(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cres(c4, cpred(c3, c1, cv(s0))))))
  wfr2(cv(s0), c1, c4, c2, c3)
  wfr3g(s0, c3, c1, c4, c2, c0)
}
